A4.text: As of 2020, there were 5,250 acute care and critical access hospitals in the United States.

A5.text: As of 2018, there were 5,534 registered hospitals in the US.

A7.text: building a data base of more than 6,500 hospitals

A8.text: the number of US hospitals shrinking from 6,933 in 1981 to 5,534 in 2016.

A9.text: In the United States, the number of hospitalizations grew to its peak in 1981 with 171 admissions per 1,000 Americans and 6,933 hospitals.
